org.zeromq.ZLoop

type
class
available in
cpp

The ZLoop class provides an event-driven reactor pattern. The reactor handles socket readers not writers, and once-off or repeated timers. its resolution is 1 msec. It uses a tickless timer to reduce CPU interrupts in inactive processes.

Note that at present, it only supports 0MQ sockets; polling of haXe Socket objects is not supported.

Based on zloop.c in czmq

Constructor

new(?logger : Dynamic -> Void)
parameters
logger (Optional). Provide a logging function that accepts zloop trace log entries generated when verbose = true.
Constructor. Generic Type parameter defines argument types passed to registered timer function handler methods

Instance Variables

verbose : Bool

Turns on verbose trace logging

Instance Methods

destroy() : Void

Destructor

registerPoller(item : PollItemT, handler : ZLoop -> ZMQSocket -> Int) : Bool

parameters
item PollItem (socket & polled-for event)
handler Handler function, receives polled ZMQSocket object
returns
true if OK, else false
Register pollitem with the reactor. When the pollitem is ready, will call the handler. Returns true if OK, else false. If you register a pollitem more than once, each instance will invoke its corresponding handler.

registerTimer(delay : Float, times : Int, handler : ZLoop -> Dynamic -> Int, ?args : Dynamic) : Bool

parameters
delay Number of milliseconds to delay event for
times Number of times to repeat, else 0 for forever
handler Handler function
args Arguments passed to timer handler function
returns
true if OK, else false
Register a timer that expires after some delay and repeats some number of times. At each expiry, will call the handler. To run a timer forever, use 0 times. Returns true if OK, false if there was an error

start() : Int

returns
Returns 0 if interrupted, -1 if cancelled by a handler
Start the reactor. Takes control of the thread and returns when the 0MQ context is terminated or the process is interrupted, or any event handler returns -1. Event handlers may register new sockets and timers, and cancel sockets.

unregisterPoller(item : PollItemT) : Void

parameters
item
Removes a previously registered poller from the reactor, specified by a socket. If multiple poll items exist for the same socket, this method removes ALL of them from the reactor.

unregisterTimer(args : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
args
Cancel all timers for a specific handler function argument object
